metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9428 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Tatsuya Kinoshita w3m fork before 0.5.3-31. Heap-based buffer overflow in the addMultirowsForm function in w3m allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9428` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

w3m - 0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1
w3m-img - 0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> same fix/workaround as for CVE-2016-9425

criterions.comment: w3m package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-26ubuntu0.1').
